resources.string: The mission of the Department of Computer Science and Information Systems at SVSU is to provide an outstanding education to its students, to advance scholarship in the key domains of the computing and information systems sciences, and to engage in activities that improve the welfare of society and enhance the reputation of SVSU.

Il-Hyung Cho is an associate professor and chair of the Department of Computer Science at Saginaw Valley State University, Michigan, where he has been since 2003. During 2010-2011 he was a Visiting Professor of Bioinformatics lab at Washington State University.\n

George Corser is an Assistant Professor of Computer Science and Information Systems (CSIS) at Saginaw Valley State University (SVSU). His research defines and analyzes location privacy and security protocols in vehicle networks. His teaching explores web and mobile app development, theoretical computer science and cybercrime. \n

I graduated with PhD in Computational Analysis and Modeling (2013) from Louisiana Tech University, Ruston, USA. Prior that, I received MS and BSc in Computer Science and Engineering from University of Dhaka, Bangladesh. I received MS in Mathematics (2011) and MS in Computer Science (2013) from Louisiana Tech University. \n
Computer Science tends to be more theoretic in nature than Computer Information Systems. It uses more abstraction and mathematics as a core skill set area.
